content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatocellular carcinoma, BCLC stage D with extensive bone metastases

I reviewed [redacted name] today following discontinuation of sorafenib therapy. Unfortunately, his disease has shown clear radiological progression on the most recent CT performed on 15 April 2024, with enlarging liver lesions and new bone metastases. His AFP has risen significantly from 25,000 to 50,000 over the past 6 weeks. His performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 3, spending most of the day in bed due to fatigue and bone pain. He requires increasing doses of opiates for pain control.

He has experienced grade 3 hand-foot syndrome and significant weight loss (12kg over 8 weeks) on sorafenib, despite dose reduction to 400mg daily from 12 March 2024. After careful discussion with the patient and family today, we have agreed to discontinue systemic therapy and focus on symptom control.

I have made an urgent referral to the palliative care team and arranged admission to the local hospice for pain management. His current medications include MST 60mg BD and oxycodone breakthrough, which need review. I have also referred him to our specialist nurse team for additional support. We will continue to provide outpatient support as needed but will not arrange routine follow-up given his declining condition.
